description:
Django and Python make fullstack and API web projects a breeze. But as
Python has matured, significant tooling has risen to improve the
development experience (DX). Can you use this tooling, in a modern
editor and IDE, to stay in the flow and make your development…joyful?

In this session we’ll put PyCharm to work, at helping us work.
Navigation, refactoring, autocomplete – the usual suspects. We’ll also
see “test-first” development to stay in the IDE, plus how this can apply
to frontends. Finally, we’ll follow along with topic’s from Adam
Johnson’s book “Boost Your Django DX”, with a surprise at the end.
title: Joyful Django DX with PyCharm  (Sponsor: JetBrains)
